TAXONOMIC CLASS.content: TAXONOMIC CLASS: Sandy, mixed Typic Cryaquents

TYPICAL PEDON.content:
TYPICAL PEDON: Abyss loam on a high flood plain, on a slopes of 1 percent at sea level (When described on June 6, 2015, the soil was moist to a depth of 30 cm and wet below that depth.)
C1--0 to 13 cm; loam, light brownish gray (10YR 6/2) dry, dark grayish brown (10YR 4/2) moist; 25 percent medium dark yellowish brown (10YR 4/6) mottles; massive; slightly hard, friable, slightly sticky and slightly plastic; common very fine, fine, and medium roots throughout; common very fine and fine interstitial pores; slightly alkaline (pH 7.5); gradual wavy boundary
C2--13 to 30 cm; sand, light gray (5Y 7/1) dry, gray (5Y 5/1) moist; massive; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common very fine and medium roots throughout; common very fine and fine interstitial pores; slightly alkaline (pH 7.6); diffuse irregular boundary
Cg--30 to 150 cm; sand, dark gray (2.5Y 4/1) dry, very dark gray (N 3/0) moist; massive; soft, very friable, nonsticky and nonplastic; common fine and medium roots throughout; few fine interstitial pores; slightly alkaline (pH 7.7)

TYPE LOCATION.content: TYPE LOCATION: Hoonah-Angoon Census Area, Alaska; latitude 58.4102570, longitude -135.6592080, datum WGS84 (coordinates determined by a GPS unit)

RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS.content:
RANGE IN CHARACTERISTICS:
Mean annual soil temperature--1 to 7 degrees C
Soil moisture control section--dry less than 45 consecutive days in June through October (udic)
Depth to redoximorphic features--25 to 50 cm
Clay content in particle-size control section--0 to 3 percent
C1 horizon
Hue--10YR, 2.5Y; variegated
Value--4 to 5 moist or dry
Chroma--2 to 3 moist, 3 to 4 dry
Fine-earth texture--loam, sandy loam, loamy sand
Clay content--0 to 3 percent
Reaction (pH)--7.1 to 7.7
Thickness--13 to 21 cm
C2 horizon
Hue--5Y; variegated
Value--3 to 5 moist or dry
Chroma--1 to 3 moist or dry
Fine-earth texture--sand, coarse sand
Clay content--0 to 2 percent
Reaction (pH)--7.6 to 7.9
Thickness--17 to 49 cm
Cg horizon
Hue--neutral to 5GY moist, 2.5Y or 5Y dry
Value--2.5 to 4 moist, 3 or 4 dry
Chroma--0 to 2 moist, 1 or 2 dry
Clay content--0 to 2 percent
Reaction (pH)--7.7 to 8.1
Thickness--82 to 122 cm

COMPETING SERIES.content:
COMPETING SERIES:
Ashmun--aquic conditions within 25 cm of soil surface; lithologic discontinuity
Chilkoot--aquic conditions within 25 cm of soil surface; stratified sandy textures; as much as 20 percent coarse fragments in lower part
Monashka--aquic conditions within 10 cm of soil surface; free carbonates throughout particle-size control section
Perouse--aquic conditions within 10 cm of soil surface; free carbonates throughout particle-size control section
Stave (T)--aquic conditions at or near the soil surface (poorly defined series)
Topsy--lithologic discontinuity; aquic conditions within 20 cm of soil surface

GEOGRAPHIC SETTING.content:
GEOGRAPHIC SETTING:
Elevation--0 to 6 m
Climate--cool, moist summers; mild, wet winters
Mean annual precipitation--850 to 1850 mm
Mean annual air temperature--1 to 7 degrees C
Frost-free period--90 to 154 days

GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS.content:
GEOGRAPHICALLY ASSOCIATED SOILS:
Scidmore--cambic horizon; not subject to flooding; on adjacent landforms
Sitakaday--aquic conditions within 20 cm of soil surface; on similar landforms

DRAINAGE AND PERMEABILITY.content:
DRAINAGE AND SATURATED HYDRAULIC CONDUCTIVITY:
Drainage class--somewhat poorly drained
Saturated hydraulic conductivity (Ksat)--high in C1 horizon, very high in C2 and Cg horizons
Flooding--occasional, very brief periods
Saturation in normal years--between depths of 30 and 150 cm

USE AND VEGETATION.content:
USE AND VEGETATION:
Use--wildlife habitat, recreation
Potential natural vegetation--seacoast angelica, marsh grass of Parnassus, little yellow rattle, goose neck moss, Barclay's willow, common cow parsnip, red fescue, common yarrow, Lyngbye's sedge, Nootka lupine

DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT.content: DISTRIBUTION AND EXTENT: Alexander Archipelago-Gulf of Alaska Coast, Alaska; MLRA 220; small extent

REGIONAL OFFICE.content: SOIL SURVEY REGIONAL OFFICE (SSRO) RESPONSIBLE: Portland, Oregon

ORIGIN.content: SERIES ESTABLISHED: Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve-Gustavus Area, Alaska; 2020; name from Abyss Lake in Glacier Bay National Park and Preserve

REMARKS.content:
REMARKS:
Diagnostic horizons and other features in this pedon
*Reduced matrix--zone from 30 to 150 cm
*Aquic conditions--zone from 30 to 150 cm
*Particle-size control section--zone from 25 to 100 cm
National Cooperative Soil Survey
U.S.A.
